questions.question: How many Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) have been agreed to?

choices.answer: Johannesburg, South Africa
Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
New York, USA
Stockholm, Sweden

questions.question: Where was the summit held to finalize the SDGs?
What institution convened the summit on SDGs?

choices.answer: US government
International Council for Science
United Nations
World Bank

questions.question: What is the target year in which the SDGs should be met?

choices.answer: A new set of goals were needed when the MDGs finished
Progress was uneven across regions and countries
New global challenges had emerged that needed consideration
This extreme step was a response to recent political climate

questions.question: Which of the following does not represent part of the rationale of the SDGs?
Each SDG is supported by a set of Targets. How many Targets are there in total?
True or False: 100% of UN member states agreed to the SDGs.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Which of the following is not part of the Sustainable Development Goals?

choices.answer: Access to sustainable energy for all
Availability of water and sanitation for all
Provision of internet services for all
Promotion of decent jobs for all

questions.question: Equality issues are specifically mentioned in how many of the SDGs (not including the targets)?

choices.answer: 2 (#6 on water, & #12 on sustainable production/consumption)
4 (#2 hunger, #7 energy, #8 economic growth, #14 oceans)
3 (#4 education, #5 gender, #10 reducing inequality)
1 (#16 on promoting peaceful and just societies for all)
Encourage promotion of health, well-being, education for all
Explicitly promote innovation
Include development of sustainable cities & infrastructure
They are legally binding international treaty

questions.question: Which of the following is not true about the SDGs?

choices.answer: Cut poverty in half by 2030
Reduce poverty by 75% by 2030
End poverty in all its forms everywhere
Help each nation make progress on reducing poverty

questions.question: Goal 1 is about poverty. What is the aim of this Goal?

choices.answer: Mobilizing financial resources necessary to achieve Goals
Creating international sports tournaments to promote SDGs
Helping developing countries build capacities
Enhancing trade to help developing nations increase exports

questions.question: Goal 17 is about strengthening partnerships for other SDGs. Which is not part of Goal 17?
SDG #13, on climate change, is some times shown with an “ * ” (asterisk) after it. Why?

choices.answer: Addressing climate change is more important than all others
Negotiators were unable to agree on a climate change Goal
Decisions were made at UN meeting in Paris (2015)
The Goal on climate change is constantly shifting
Halt and reverse land degradation
Halt biodiversity loss
Halt the use of biotechnology and genetic engineering
Use ecosystems sustainably while protecting & restoring them

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT part of Goal 15, on ecosystems?
What can individuals do to help realize the achievement of the SDGs?

choices.answer: Hold their governments and the private sector accountable
Create projects and partnerships of their own
Use positions in society to voice support for SDGs
All of the above ... and more
